thread.title: Bird feeders may spread an illness that blinds finches
thread.title_full: Bird feeders may spread an illness that blinds finches - The Washington Post

author: Nancy Szokan
title: Bird feeders may spread an illness that blinds finches
text:
Feeding birds can help them survive harsh winters, but you may want to take steps to guard them against transmitting an eye disease. (Douglas Allen/iStock) By Nancy Szokan October 5 at 1:35 PM North American songbirds are vulnerable to a common, naturally occurring disease called mycoplasmal conjunctivitis, which causes red and swollen eyes. It’s a type of pinkeye, and sometimes it leads to blindness — which soon leads to death.
Humans can’t get this disease, but new research from
